children.subject: EE 192 or ME 131 might be a fun class to get some experience putting something together and getting it working in the real world

I'm honestly surprised that no one's suggested CS 184 (Graphics), since it satisfies the design requirement and is relevant to your intended area of concentration. Certainly, EECS 149 and CS 162 are both great options (with CS 162 probably entailing quite a bit more work), but I'd definitely recommend that you at least consider CS 184.

history.content:
Hi all,

I'm a rising junior pursuing a degree in EECS. My current focus is in Signals, Systems, and ML. I want to diversify my knowledge by pursuing this scattered plan. My current plan for each module in my focus is as follows:

  • Core: CS 170
  • Signals/Systems: EE 120, EE 123
  • AI/ML: EECS 126, EECS 127, CS 188, CS 189
  • Design: EECS 149 OR CS 162

Thus, I am conflicted on which design course to take. On one hand, I am working on side projects which directly apply to embedded systems (149). It seems easier to self teach experience in embedded systems with side projects.

I don't have experience with OS technicals and most likely will not get a chance to get that experience except for with 162. And I've seen professors like Sahai mention that both 149 and 162 are classes that are core for people pursuing versatility in the industry. But I also don't want to take both because I don't have the time to do two design classes. What should I prioritize? EECS 149 or CS 162?

Additionally, I am looking for another class that might supplement this focus (in Signals, AI/ML, Systems). Any suggestions would be great!
history.subject: EECS 149 or CS 162
